description: Bulk Random Customer Creation - Allow users to generate and create 1-1000 random customers at once for testing and demo purposes using a performant bulk API endpoint

userStories.title: Random Customer Data Generator Service
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a service that generates realistic random customer data so that the bulk endpoint can create varied test data.
acceptanceCriteria: IRandomCustomerGenerator service interface created in Services folder
RandomCustomerGenerator implementation generates realistic random names (first + last name combinations from predefined lists)
Generates valid random email addresses based on generated name with random domain
Generates random phone numbers in valid format (e.g., +1-XXX-XXX-XXXX)
Generates random addresses with street, city, state/region, postal code, and country
GenerateCustomers(int count) method returns list of CreateCustomerDto objects
All generated emails are unique within a batch (append index or random suffix if needed)
Service is registered as scoped service in DI container in Program.cs
Code builds successfully
All tests pass with code coverage greater than 80%

userStories.title: Bulk Create Customers API Endpoint
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a bulk create endpoint so that the frontend can create many customers in a single API call.
acceptanceCriteria: POST /api/customers/bulk endpoint added to CustomersController
Endpoint accepts a BulkCreateRequestDto with 'count' property (int)
Endpoint uses IRandomCustomerGenerator to generate customer data
Returns 400 Bad Request if count exceeds 1000 or is less than 1
BulkCreateResponseDto includes: successCount (int), failureCount (int), createdCustomers (array of CustomerResponseDto), errors (array of BulkCreateError with index and message)
Successfully created customers are committed even if some fail validation
Uses Entity Framework AddRange() for batch insert performance
Endpoint documented in Swagger with appropriate attributes
Code builds successfully
All tests pass with code coverage greater than 80%

userStories.title: API Client Bulk Create Method
userStories.description: As a frontend developer, I need an API client method to call the bulk create endpoint so that UI components can trigger bulk creation.
acceptanceCriteria: BulkCreateResponse type defined in lib/api/types.ts with successCount, failureCount, createdCustomers, and errors
BulkCreateError type defined with index (number) and message (string)
customerApi.bulkCreateRandom(count: number) method added to CustomerApiClient
Method calls POST /api/customers/bulk with { count } body
Method has extended timeout (30 seconds) for large batches
Returns typed BulkCreateResponse on success
Handles API errors appropriately with ApiError class
Code builds successfully
All tests pass with code coverage greater than 80%

userStories.title: Bulk Create Customer UI Dialog
userStories.description: As a user, I want a UI control to specify how many random customers to create so that I can quickly populate the database for testing.
acceptanceCriteria: GenerateCustomersDialog component created in src/components/GenerateCustomersDialog.tsx
Dialog uses existing shadcn/ui Dialog, Input, Button, and Label components
Dialog contains number input for customer count with min=1 and max=1000
Input validates range and shows error message for invalid values (empty, <1, >1000, non-integer)
Generate button is disabled when input is invalid or while loading
Dialog has Cancel button to close without action
Dialog accepts onSuccess callback prop to notify parent of completion
Code builds successfully
All tests pass with code coverage greater than 80%
Verify in browser using dev-browser skill

userStories.title: Integrate Bulk Create Dialog into Customer List Page
userStories.description: As a user, I want to access the bulk create feature from the customer list page so that I can quickly generate test data.
acceptanceCriteria: Generate Random Customers button added to customer list page header/actions area
Button uses outline variant to differentiate from primary actions
Clicking button opens the GenerateCustomersDialog
Loading state shown in dialog while bulk creation is in progress with 'Creating X customers...' message
Success toast shows count of successfully created customers (e.g., 'Successfully created 100 customers')
If partial failure, toast shows both success and failure counts (e.g., 'Created 95 customers. 5 failed.')
Error toast shown if entire operation fails
Customer list refreshes automatically after successful creation
Dialog closes automatically on completion (success or partial success)
